intro: Trichanthecium micranthum, commonly known as the small-flowered trichanthecium, is a flowering plant species belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, wind-dispersed seeds. Trichanthecium micranthum is often found in temperate regions and is of interest to botanists due to its ecological role in supporting pollinators.
